name.ch: 半導體晶圓鍵合科學與技術

goal.ch: 本課程目標：學習晶圓鍵合(wafer bonding)基礎理論及技術，進而在各個領域能有創新應用。晶圓鍵合技術除了應用於製作微顯示器 (Micro-display)、光電複合材料、奈微機電 (NMEMS) 器件、立體積體電路 (3D-IC) 、5G 元件核心材料等先進工業技術外，甚至可製作柔性基板 (compliant substrate) ，以磊晶生長(epitaxial growth) 零差排之完美晶體在異質基板上，例如，氮化鎵單晶薄膜在石墨烯與碳化矽鍵合的基板 (GaN on Silicon)。
goal.en: "The course aims to be (1) basic teaching materials (2) assigned SCI papers to help students build effective wafer bonding related theoretical basis, and then having the ability for the development of its innovative applications.In addition to wafer bonding technique used in the production of micro-display, photoelectric composite, nanoscale microelectromechanical (NMEMS) devices, 3D-IC, 5G device core materials, and other advanced microelectronics industry technology, and even can be made flexible perfect crystal substrate (compliant substrate), to epitaxial growth (epitaxial growth) of zero dislocation on heterogeneous substrates, such as gallium nitride single crystal thin film on the bonded pair of graphene and silicon carbide (GaN on graphene/SiC)."

outline.ch:
本課程以激發同學自學精神而習得新知方法進行，授課時間共計十六週。進度是前六週採授課講解方式，協助修習同學奠定基礎。
第七週起採取翻轉教學方式 (Flipped Class Model)，即每週指定閱讀材料，課堂將由數位被指定同學講解，討論，分享閱讀知識，再由老師做評論總結。採用翻轉教學概念，本課程無家庭作業 (homework) 但有課堂作業 (classwork)。
翻轉教學實施流程：指定閱讀材料及報告群 —> 週前討論  —> 課堂報告  —>  評分
＊無法參與週前討論者，切勿選修！
翻轉教學上課模式總結：＊前六週：傳統教學－課堂講解－奠定基礎分組分配閱讀SCI論文＊第七週起翻轉教學－課堂發表之實施方法：(1) 發表前 1～2週 預先與教授會面作主題討論(2) 課堂發表－評分
課程講授範疇，但不限定：
簡介
Introduction(如何藉由晶圓鍵合技術讓材料能藉原子鍵兩兩結合在一起)
基礎與原理
Basics of Interactions Between Flat Surfaces(期待能結合在一起是材料表面原子產生鍵結之""天性"")Influence of Particles, Surface Steps, and Cavities(兩材料表面結合之後可能會產生的問題)Surface Preparation/Room Temperature Wafer Bonding(材料表面開始結合之前的準備工作)Thermal Treatment of Bonded Wafer Pairs(讓兩材料互相鍵結起來，緊黏貼在一塊的熱處理製程)
製程與應用
Thinning Procedures (如何產生奈米薄膜)Electrical Properties of Bonding Interfaces (∵ 鍵合接面的電子性質對電子元件的影響很大)Stresses in Bonded Wafers (∵ 結合後會產生壓力，影響到鍵合後材料的""存活率"")Bonding of Dissimilar Materials(如何結合不同的材料，但不產生有類似移植器官""排斥""的現象)Bonding of Structured Wafers & Mainstream Applications(討論應用在微機電元件的結構性材料)Emerging and Future Applications (討論製作新興產品的應用及發展：以光電元件為重點)"
outline.en:
"
The progress of the course (total=16 weeks) will comprise the first six weeks to explain the basic concept of wafer bonding; then, from the 7th week, the course will be in the
Flipped Class Model
: to assign weekly reading materials to let students in next week feel free to discuss and share knowledge obtained by reading and finally the professor makes a summary. This course has no homework but classwork, and the final score contains the evaluation of notes.
